API¶

class abnumber.Chain(sequence, name=None, scheme='imgt', allowed_species=None, aa_dict=None, chain_type=None)¶

Structure storing an aligned antibody chain using a chosen antibody numbering scheme

Use Chain(‘EVQLQV…’) to create a Chain from an unaligned amino acid sequence

align(*others) → abnumber.chain.Alignment¶

Align this chain to other chains by using their existing numbering :param others: Chains to align :return: Alignment object

clone(replace_seq: str = None)¶

Create a copy of this chain, optionally with a replacement sequence that is placed into the same numbering :param replace_seq: Optional replacement sequence, needs to be the same length :return: new Chain object

graft_cdrs_onto(other: abnumber.chain.Chain, name: str = None) → abnumber.chain.Chain¶

Graft CDRs from this Chain onto another chain :param other: Chain to graft CDRs into :param name: Name of new Chain :return: Chain with CDRs grafted from this chain and frameworks from the given chain

property positions¶

Get dictionary of Position -> Amino acid :return: dictionary of Position -> Amino acid

property regions¶

Get dictionary of region dictionaries (Position -> Amino acid) :return: Dictionary of Region name -> dictionary of (Position -> Amino acid)

property seq¶

Get unaligned string representation of the variable chain sequence :return: Unaligned string representation of the variable chain sequence

class abnumber.Alignment(positions, residues)¶
class abnumber.Position(chain_type: str, number: int, letter: str, scheme: str)¶
